text: Roy Barraclough, MBE (12 July 1935 â€“ 1 June 2017) was an English comic actor. He was best known for his role as Alec Gilroy in the long-running British TV soap Coronation Street, and for the double-act Cissie and Ada with comedian Les Dawson. In the 2006 New Year Honours, Barraclough was appointed a Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE) for services to drama and to charity in the North West. He was the recipient of three Manchester Evening News Theatre Awards including the Reader's Award, a Liverpool Echo Theatre Award and a Royal Television Society Award. Barraclough died aged 81, at the Willow Wood Hospice in Ashton-under-Lyne, Greater Manchester, on 1 June 2017, after a short illness. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Corrie.net Profile Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in England Category:English movie actors Category:English television actors Category:English comedians Category:Actors from Lancashire
